meanings.definition: A type of elementary particle similar to an electron but with a greater mass.
meanings.sent1: Scientists study muons to learn more about particles.
meanings.sent2: Muons can penetrate deep into materials due to their high energy.
meanings.sent3: The muons at the particle party were the heaviest dancers.
meanings.sent4: In the world of particles, muons are like the heavyweight champions.
meanings.sent5: Imagine muons as tiny, heavy messengers zipping through space.

meanings.sent1: The detector picked up muons moving through the chamber.
meanings.sent2: Negatively charged muons interact with other particles in unique ways.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous muons played pranks on the electrons in the lab.
meanings.sent4: In the realm of particles, muons are the rebels with a negative cause.
meanings.sent5: Picture muons as tiny, charged adventurers exploring the unknown.
